title: STM Adult Lap Swim
description:
Date: March 17, 2022

Enjoy exclusive lap swim in the Early Bird hours from 7:00 - 8:30 a.m. and Night Owl hours from 7:00 - 8:30 p.m., Monday through Friday at select outdoor pools. Meet the challenge of swimming 25 miles or more over the summer months and earn a 25-miler t-shirt or test yourself by entering a top 3 swimmer competition at your pool and win a first, second or third place distance trophy. Those who complete 25 miles or place among the top 3 distance swimmers at their pool are invited to attend an end of season awards party that includes refreshments, live music, a synchronized swim exhibition and competitive relay races to celebrate health and fitness achievements.

title: Forest Fitness
description:
Date: March 17, 2022

Join the Fort Tryon Park Trust for a free, year-round “Fitness at the Fort” exercise program on Tuesdays, Thursdays, and Saturdays! This regular fitness class incorporates climbing multiple staircases, stretches and strengthening exercises, notable tree identification, and forest bathing. Led by Nancy Bruning, BA, MPH, PAPHS.

Tuesdays at 7:30 a.m.: Easy Pace
Meet at the Heather Garden entrance. Walk along Stan Michels Promenade to Linden Terrace for dynamic warm-up stretching and cardio stair climbing. Walk south to Cabrini Woods for cardio steps and strengthening exercises and walk uphill to Billings Overlook for closing stretches.

Thursdays at 7:30 a.m.: Moderate Pace
Meet at the Heather Garden entrance and walk along Stan Michels Promenade to Linden Terrace for dynamic warm-up stretching and cardio stair climbing. Walk along the western path to Broadway, incorporating strengthening exercises, and walk uphill past Gazebo/Dog Run to Café Lawn, end with stretches.

Saturdays at 8:30 a.m.: Intense Pace
Meet at the Heather Garden entrance and walk along Stan Michels Promenade to Linden Terrace for dynamic warm-up stretch and cardio stair climbing. Walk along the western path to Broadway, incorporating strengthening exercises. Walk uphill towards Gazebo/Dog Run, utilizing a cluster of steps west of Broadway Path. Walk along the upper Alpine Garden path, to volleyball courts for stretches with final stair climbing to Margaret Corbin Circle.

(Note: Fitness Walking does not meet if it is raining or if the actual temperature or wind chill is below 20 degrees F.)

Start time: 7:30 am

End time: 8:30 am

Contact phone: 2127951388

Location: Margaret Corbin Circle (in Fort Tryon Park)
location: Margaret Corbin Circle (in Fort Tryon Park)
categories: Nature | Fitness | Seniors | Hiking | Exercise Classes | Strength Training/Weightlifting | Walking

title: Illuminating Histories™: Women's History Month
description:
Date: March 17, 2022

Illuminating Histories™ (I.H.) is a FREE family-friendly virtual STEAM workshop series by artist Tasha Dougé in collaboration with the Lewis Latimer House Museum. It seeks to shed light on the hidden legacies of Black historical figures through innovative, immersive artistic approaches and applications. Participants are welcome to join any number of the five virtual STEAM workshops. This series takes place third Thursday afternoons of the month in February - June 2022.

Teaching Artist: Tasha Dougé

I.H. will honor Velma P. Scantlebury, M.D., the nation’s first black female transplant surgeon, and bring awareness to the kidneys through craft making.

We will discuss the role of the kidney, how many we have, kidney illness, and donation all by creating light-up kidneys!

For this workshop we suggest participants have access to a dark room, ie: bathroom, closet, or ability to close curtains.

Please have the following list of materials ready:

  • Assorted paper (plain, construction, origami, etc.)
  • Red and/ or brown tissue paper
  • Scissors
  • Pencils, crayons, or markers

Start time: 3:30 pm

End time: 4:30 pm

Contact phone: (718) 961-8585

Location: Virtual/Online Workshop
categories: Arts & Crafts | Education | Art | History | Best for Kids | Women's History Month | Virtual/Online Events

title: Musical Ecologies: Al Margolis
description:
Date: March 17, 2022

Musical Ecologies continues on Thursday, March 17 with New York-based composer and sound artist Al Margolis. Active since the early 1980s, Margolis is well-known for his DIY experimental electronic performances and compositions, often made under the alias If, Bwana, as well as for the two prolific publishing labels he founded, Sound of Pig Music and Pogus Productions. For tonight’s performance, he will perform a live set for violin, contact mics, and various objects, as well as present a new prerecorded studio composition. The evening will begin with a conversation hosted by series curator Dan Joseph.

About Musica Ecologies:

Founded in 2012, Musical Ecologies is a monthly symposium on music and sound held at the Old Stone House in Park Slope, Brooklyn. Curated and hosted by composer Dan Joseph, each event focuses on a single artist who presents a recent work or project in the form of a talk or lecture, a multimedia presentation, a performance, or a combination thereof. Each presentation is preceded by an extended conversation between the artist and curator.

About the artist:

Al Margolis has been active as a self-trained composer since 1984. He makes music that has swung between fairly spontaneous studio constructions and more process-oriented composition, primarily under the name If, Bwana which he began using on New Year’s day 1984. Central to his musical explorations has been a profound love for sound and its manipulation, for prickly timbres and sandpaper-like drones, for surprising juxtapositions and unexpected beauty. And yet, the concrete manifestations of this love have defied typical genre classifications as much as the delineation of an easily pin-pointable style. Emerging from the buoyant tape scene of the '80s as part of his own Sound of Pig label’s artist roster, Margolis’s work has continued to evolve from noise towards sample-heavy collages and onto towards contemporary composition. Margolis’s music represents a vigorous, original, and informed continuation of the experimental traditions of American music.

Get your tickets here, proof of vaccination required to attend

Please note: the venue is not wheelchair accessible.

Start time: 8:00 pm

End time: 10:00 pm

Contact phone:

Location: Old Stone House (in J.J. Byrne Playground)

title: Forest Restoration Fridays
description:
Date: March 18, 2022

Van Cortlandt Park in the Bronx consists of 640 acres of forest and freshwater wetlands. Help Van Cortlandt Park Alliance maintain this important ecosystem.

During the month of March, VCPA’s weekly Forest Restoration Fridays will meet in front of the Woodlawn Playground and take place in the Northeast Forest of Van Cortlandt Park. Volunteers will assist our staff with the removal of shrub and vine species that harm the biodiversity and health of the park.

Bring along a water bottle and wear sturdy closed-toed shoes and long pants.

Please be advised that as of December 27, 2021, a vaccine mandate has been ordered by the City of New York. In order to participate in Van Cortlandt Park Alliance volunteer events, all volunteers must be vaccinated.

Start time: 9:00 am

End time: 12:00 pm

Wake Up, Daisy! tells the story of Daisy, a lively little girl living in the heart of New York City in an apartment overlooking Central Park. At Daisy’s much-anticipated birthday party, she encounters three special guests, known as her “Squad-parents”, from Brooklyn, Queens, and the Bronx who grant her the gifts of courage, knowledge, and a second chance. When an unwelcome guest shows up and casts a curse on her, Daisy’s life is forever changed. But through the support of her friends and an adventure throughout the city, Daisy’s strong self-determination and vivid imagination may be all she needs to break the curse.

title: Forest Fitness
description:
Date: March 19, 2022

Join the Fort Tryon Park Trust for a free, year-round “Fitness at the Fort” exercise program on Tuesdays, Thursdays, and Saturdays! This regular fitness class incorporates climbing multiple staircases, stretches and strengthening exercises, notable tree identification, and forest bathing. Led by Nancy Bruning, BA, MPH, PAPHS.

Tuesdays at 7:30 a.m.: Easy Pace
Meet at the Heather Garden entrance. Walk along Stan Michels Promenade to Linden Terrace for dynamic warm-up stretching and cardio stair climbing. Walk south to Cabrini Woods for cardio steps and strengthening exercises and walk uphill to Billings Overlook for closing stretches.

Thursdays at 7:30 a.m.: Moderate Pace
Meet at the Heather Garden entrance and walk along Stan Michels Promenade to Linden Terrace for dynamic warm-up stretching and cardio stair climbing. Walk along the western path to Broadway, incorporating strengthening exercises, and walk uphill past Gazebo/Dog Run to Café Lawn, end with stretches.

Saturdays at 8:30 a.m.: Intense Pace
Meet at the Heather Garden entrance and walk along Stan Michels Promenade to Linden Terrace for dynamic warm-up stretch and cardio stair climbing. Walk along the western path to Broadway, incorporating strengthening exercises. Walk uphill towards Gazebo/Dog Run, utilizing a cluster of steps west of Broadway Path. Walk along the upper Alpine Garden path, to volleyball courts for stretches with final stair climbing to Margaret Corbin Circle.

(Note: Fitness Walking does not meet if it is raining or if the actual temperature or wind chill is below 20 degrees F.)

Start time: 8:30 am

End time: 9:30 am

Contact phone: 2127951388

Location: Margaret Corbin Circle (in Fort Tryon Park)
location: Margaret Corbin Circle (in Fort Tryon Park)
categories: Nature | Fitness | Seniors | Hiking | Exercise Classes | Strength Training/Weightlifting | Walking

title: Spring Cleaning
description:
Date: March 19, 2022

Join the Freshkills Park Alliance and NYC Parks for a volunteer day at Schmul Park and discover ways to get creative in our green spaces and support the bees! Ages 12+

We will work together to remove harmful plants and litter, learn how to establish complex pollinator ecosystems, and highlight all the ways pollinators support our parks and our planet!

Please note: As per NYC Parks policy, volunteers must sign an activity waiver and will be required to show proof they have received two doses of the Pfizer or Moderna vaccine, or the one dose of the Johnson & Johnson vaccine in order to participate.

Plan Ahead: Wear long pants, close-toed shoes, and insect repellant. Also wear a hat and bring water and a snack. Tools, gloves, masks, and sanitizer will be provided. Do not attend if you are sick or have been exposed to COVID-19.

Can't make it? You can still help by promoting our volunteer projects with your friends and neighbors. Students can receive credit for community service hours. We will also be adding more volunteer opportunities as the season continues. For more information about upcoming volunteer opportunities, check out our website at freshkillspark.org/volunteer.

Start time: 9:00 am

End time: 12:00 pm

Contact phone: (212) 602-5372

Location: Schmul Park
categories: Volunteer

description:

The first annual Freshkills Park Earth Day Festival is coming to the New Springville Greenway on April 23, 2022. Join the Freshkills Park Alliance and NYC Parks for a volunteer day at our Studio + Gallery and help us get ready. Ages 18+

We will work together to remove harmful plants and debris, spread new soil, help with light pruning, and more!

Please note: As per NYC Parks policy, volunteers must sign an activity waiver and will be required to show proof they have received two doses of the Pfizer or Moderna vaccine, or the one dose of the Johnson & Johnson vaccine in order to participate.

Plan Ahead: Wear long pants, close-toed shoes, and insect repellant. Also wear a hat and bring water and a snack. Tools, gloves, masks, and sanitizer will be provided. Do not attend if you are sick or have been exposed to COVID-19.

Can't make it? You can still help by promoting our volunteer projects with your friends and neighbors. Students can receive credit for community service hours. We will also be adding more volunteer opportunities as the season continues. For more information about upcoming volunteer opportunities, check out our website at freshkillspark.org/volunteer.

title: Tibbetts Brook Trash Cleanup
description:
Date: March 19, 2022

Tibbetts Brook, a small freshwater river, cuts through the heart of Van Cortlandt Park in the Bronx. Join us to help clean it!

Join the Van Cortlandt Park Alliance as we spend the morning cleaning Tibbetts Brook. We will be working along the shores and in the stream removing trash and debris.

Dress warm, bring water, and wear sturdy shoes and long pants. Some volunteers can walk up the Putnam to join some staff up near the border removing trash from the Brook. Others can stay close to the Van Cortlandt Golf Course Clubhouse and clean up along the shores of the pond.

RSVP on Eventbrite

Please be advised that as of December 27, a vaccine mandate has been ordered by the City of New York. In order to participate in Van Cortlandt Park Alliance volunteer events, all volunteers must be vaccinated.

Start time: 10:00 am

End time: 1:00 pm

title: It's My Park at Oakwood Beach
description:
Date: March 19, 2022

Join NYC H2O along with the National Resources Protective Association for a volunteer cleanup at Oakwood Beach! Oakwood Beach and adjoining wetlands deal with a double-edged sword of being a secret to most of Staten island. While the wildlife holds strong, the few people that are around, and the close proximity to a waste plant, brings in a huge amount of trash. The site holds one of the highest density populations of Osprey seen on the Island - including Fresh Kills. The cleanup will run from 10am to 12:00pm. Gloves, garbage bags and pickers will be provided. Please wear your mask! Please register at https://www.eventbrite.com/e/oakwood-beach-cleanup-tickets-233612319737?mc_eid=ebb75b51fa&mc_cid=e489085c9f.

title: Wake Up, Daisy! at the Swedish Cottage Marionette Theatre
description:
Date: March 19, 2022

For more information on the Swedish Cottage Marionette Theatre, our COVID-19 policy and to purchase tickets, visit our website.

Wake Up, Daisy! tells the story of Daisy, a lively little girl living in the heart of New York City in an apartment overlooking Central Park. At Daisy’s much-anticipated birthday party, she encounters three special guests, known as her “Squad-parents”, from Brooklyn, Queens, and the Bronx who grant her the gifts of courage, knowledge, and a second chance. When an unwelcome guest shows up and casts a curse on her, Daisy’s life is forever changed. But through the support of her friends and an adventure throughout the city, Daisy’s strong self-determination and vivid imagination may be all she needs to break the curse.

Start time: 11:00 am

End time: 11:45 am

Contact phone: (212) 879-0794

title: STEAM Workshop: Inspired to Invent!
description:
Date: March 19, 2022

Our monthly STEAM workshops are FREE for families and children interested in joining us for fun hands-on activities based on an education approach that combines Science, Technology, Engineering, the Arts and Mathematics.

Come to the lab of famed inventor Lewis Latimer at the Lewis Latimer House Museum to make an invention of your own! Use your imagination to come up with a great idea, then explore the design process from start to finish as you design and build your invention.

This workshop will be led by educators from ArchForKids, which provides engaging experiences in design with many different venues e.g. Grinton I. Will Public Library, Larchmont Public Library, Rye Free Reading Room, Brooklyn Public Library, etc.

Audience:

  • Children ages 5 and up
  • Families welcome

*Proof of vaccination is not required in accordance with NYC guidelines. However, guests aged 12 or above must wear masks in all indoor spaces at the Museum.*

Start time: 3:00 pm

End time: 4:30 pm

Contact phone: (718) 961-8585

Location: Lewis H Latimer House
categories: Arts & Crafts | Education | Art | Best for Kids

title: Greenbelt Conservation Corps: Trail Stewardship Project Series
description:
Date: March 20, 2022

Join the Greenbelt Conservation Corps for this ongoing 2022 trail stewardship project designed to engage individuals with a sense of community, and wish to make the Greenbelt a better place!

This monthly GCC stewardship event will cover the basics of trail design, building, removal of harmful plants, and maintenance requirements while reestablishing a section of the N and E Trail in the LaTourette section of the Greenbelt.

The project site is accessible from the Greenbelt Nature Center on moderate and uneven terrain. Participants will be asked to carry tools and materials to and from the worksite.

Register on Eventbrite

Required gear: Long pants and boots/sturdy shoes. Please bring water, a snack, sunscreen, and insect repellent. Tools and PPE will be provided.

Start time: 9:00 am

End time: 3:00 pm

Contact phone:

Location: Greenbelt Nature Center (in Blood Root Valley)

description:
Date: March 20, 2022

For more information on the Swedish Cottage Marionette Theatre, our COVID-19 policy and to purchase tickets, visit our website.

Wake Up, Daisy! tells the story of Daisy, a lively little girl living in the heart of New York City in an apartment overlooking Central Park. At Daisy’s much-anticipated birthday party, she encounters three special guests, known as her “Squad-parents”, from Brooklyn, Queens, and the Bronx who grant her the gifts of courage, knowledge, and a second chance. When an unwelcome guest shows up and casts a curse on her, Daisy’s life is forever changed. But through the support of her friends and an adventure throughout the city, Daisy’s strong self-determination and vivid imagination may be all she needs to break the curse.

description:

Enjoy exclusive lap swim in the Early Bird hours from 7:00 - 8:30 a.m. and Night Owl hours from 7:00 - 8:30 p.m., Monday through Friday at select outdoor pools. Meet the challenge of swimming 25 miles or more over the summer months and earn a 25-miler t-shirt or test yourself by entering a top 3 swimmer competition at your pool and win a first, second or third place distance trophy. title: Forest Fitness
description:
Date: March 22, 2022

Join the Fort Tryon Park Trust for a free, year-round “Fitness at the Fort” exercise program on Tuesdays, Thursdays, and Saturdays! This regular fitness class incorporates climbing multiple staircases, stretches and strengthening exercises, notable tree identification, and forest bathing. Led by Nancy Bruning, BA, MPH, PAPHS.

Tuesdays at 7:30 a.m.: Easy Pace
Meet at the Heather Garden entrance. Walk along Stan Michels Promenade to Linden Terrace for dynamic warm-up stretching and cardio stair climbing. Walk south to Cabrini Woods for cardio steps and strengthening exercises and walk uphill to Billings Overlook for closing stretches.

Thursdays at 7:30 a.m.: Moderate Pace
Meet at the Heather Garden entrance and walk along Stan Michels Promenade to Linden Terrace for dynamic warm-up stretching and cardio stair climbing. Walk along the western path to Broadway, incorporating strengthening exercises, and walk uphill past Gazebo/Dog Run to Café Lawn, end with stretches.

Saturdays at 8:30 a.m.: Intense Pace
Meet at the Heather Garden entrance and walk along Stan Michels Promenade to Linden Terrace for dynamic warm-up stretch and cardio stair climbing. Walk along the western path to Broadway, incorporating strengthening exercises. Walk uphill towards Gazebo/Dog Run, utilizing a cluster of steps west of Broadway Path. Walk along the upper Alpine Garden path, to volleyball courts for stretches with final stair climbing to Margaret Corbin Circle.

(Note: Fitness Walking does not meet if it is raining or if the actual temperature or wind chill is below 20 degrees F.)

Start time: 7:30 am

End time: 8:30 am

Contact phone: (212) 795-1388

Location: Margaret Corbin Circle (in Fort Tryon Park)
location: Margaret Corbin Circle (in Fort Tryon Park)

title: STM Adult Lap Swim
description:
Date: March 23, 2022

Enjoy exclusive lap swim in the Early Bird hours from 7:00 - 8:30 a.m. and Night Owl hours from 7:00 - 8:30 p.m., Monday through Friday at select outdoor pools. Meet the challenge of swimming 25 miles or more over the summer months and earn a 25-miler t-shirt or test yourself by entering a top 3 swimmer competition at your pool and win a first, second or third place distance trophy. Those who complete 25 miles or place among the top 3 distance swimmers at their pool are invited to attend an end of season awards party that includes refreshments, live music, a synchronized swim exhibition and competitive relay races to celebrate health and fitness achievements.

title: Virtual Special Express Writers
description:
Date: March 23, 2022

Illuminating the voices of adults living with developmental challenges.

Participants are guided through writing for self-expression via virtual class. Participants encourage and support each other. Patrons may dictate or write their stories. The facilitator focuses on the participants' strengths to assure their success. Participants submit stories to compile for a production.

Sessions are fluid to allow for individual differences and participants select who or what they wish to write to.

Participants should have an interest in writing stories and memoirs.

To register, please call (718) 365-5516 or email Lucy.Aponte@parksnyc.gov.

title: Argentine Tango
description:
Date: March 23, 2022

Argentine Tango is a partner dance that developed over the last century in Argentina's capital city, Buenos Aires. It is very different from the Tango in International and American ballroom dancing. Argentine Tango is an interpretive, improvisational social dance that allows the dancers to develop a deep connection between themselves, the music, and the environment in which they are dancing.

title: TALLER PARA VOLUNTARIOS: CONTRIBUYA A SU PARQUE
description:
Date: March 23, 2022

Partnerships for Parks está ofreciendo cursos, este curso virtual de entrenamiento será en español traducido en ingles. Alguna vez se ha preguntado ¿cómo puede contribuir a mantener un parque cerca de tu comunidad? Este curso virtual servirá como una introducción a las maneras en que usted puede apoyar a su parque local y a NYC Parks.

En este curso virtual se impartirá temas referentes a cómo ser un voluntario para asistir a los parques y áreas verdes urbanas, información de crear grupos para colaborar en equipo en su comunidad. A través de un subsidio Partnership for Parks ofrece un máximo de $3,000 por grupo que le interese cooperar con el mantenimiento/embellecimiento de los parques y áreas verdes urbanas.

Temas:

  • Va a conocer las maneras de colaborar con NYC Parks.
  • Como embellecer sus parques a través del programa “It’s My Park”
  • Testimonios de cómo un voluntario puede embellecer y mantener un parque próspero.

Los presentadores serán anunciados próximamente.

Recomendamos llenar la registración para el entrenamiento lo más pronto posible. La registración terminará el día antes del entrenamiento (22 de Marzo). No habrá registración después de este día incluyendo el día del entrenamiento. Los participantes registrados recibirán el enlace para asistir al entrenamiento a su correo electrónico. Si necesita ayuda para registrarse por favor enviar un correo electrónico a academy@cityparksfoundation.org para recibir ayuda y ver una grabación.

En Partnerships for Parks, ayudamos a las personas, las organizaciones y el gobierno a trabajar juntos para apoyar los parques, jardines, árboles y otros espacios verdes de la ciudad de Nueva York. Nuestros talleres gratuitos son una excelente manera de establecer contactos y aprender las habilidades necesarias para iniciar, construir o mantener un grupo de parques comunitarios.

Start time: 6:00 pm

End time: 7:00 pm

Contact phone:

Location: Virtual/Online Workshop
categories: Education | Workshops | Virtual/Online Events

title: Forest Fitness
description:
Date: March 24, 2022

Join the Fort Tryon Park Trust for a free, year-round “Fitness at the Fort” exercise program on Tuesdays, Thursdays, and Saturdays! This regular fitness class incorporates climbing multiple staircases, stretches and strengthening exercises, notable tree identification, and forest bathing. Led by Nancy Bruning, BA, MPH, PAPHS.

Tuesdays at 7:30 a.m.: Easy Pace
Meet at the Heather Garden entrance. Walk along Stan Michels Promenade to Linden Terrace for dynamic warm-up stretching and cardio stair climbing. Walk south to Cabrini Woods for cardio steps and strengthening exercises and walk uphill to Billings Overlook for closing stretches.

Thursdays at 7:30 a.m.: Moderate Pace
Meet at the Heather Garden entrance and walk along Stan Michels Promenade to Linden Terrace for dynamic warm-up stretching and cardio stair climbing. Walk along the western path to Broadway, incorporating strengthening exercises, and walk uphill past Gazebo/Dog Run to Café Lawn, end with stretches.

Saturdays at 8:30 a.m.: Intense Pace
Meet at the Heather Garden entrance and walk along Stan Michels Promenade to Linden Terrace for dynamic warm-up stretch and cardio stair climbing. Walk along the western path to Broadway, incorporating strengthening exercises. Walk uphill towards Gazebo/Dog Run, utilizing a cluster of steps west of Broadway Path. Walk along the upper Alpine Garden path, to volleyball courts for stretches with final stair climbing to Margaret Corbin Circle.

(Note: Fitness Walking does not meet if it is raining or if the actual temperature or wind chill is below 20 degrees F.)

Start time: 7:30 am

End time: 8:30 am

Contact phone: 2127951388

Location: Margaret Corbin Circle (in Fort Tryon Park)
location: Margaret Corbin Circle (in Fort Tryon Park)
categories: Nature | Fitness | Seniors | Hiking | Exercise Classes | Strength Training/Weightlifting | Walking

title: Concert: Debbie Knapper
description:
Date: March 24, 2022

Debbie Knapper is a renowned funk guitarist whose career spans decades, playing locally and abroad. She taught herself by ear starting at age 13. At age 19, she landed her first paying gig with gospel and R&B Sensation, Marvin Sease. Since then, her incredible talent has been undeniable. She has recorded with the legendary producer Mtume, done world tours with Kit McClure, Kelis and Breaking Point, and played with various artists including Toshi Reagon, Cuba Gooding Sr, from the Main Ingredients among others. In the 80s and 90s she was co-musical director for the all-female band IBIS, and currently she leads her own band, Knappertime. For the last 17 years she has run a popping and successful Open Mic every Sunday night at Oasis in Baldwin, NY. In partnership with the Jazz Foundation of America.

Start time: 6:30 pm

End time: 8:00 pm

Contact phone:

Location: Hamilton Fish Recreation Center (in Hamilton Fish Park)

title: Forest Restoration Fridays
description:
Date: March 25, 2022

Van Cortlandt Park in the Bronx consists of 640 acres of forest and freshwater wetlands. Help Van Cortlandt Park Alliance maintain this important ecosystem.

During the month of March, VCPA’s weekly Forest Restoration Fridays will meet in front of the Woodlawn Playground and take place in the Northeast Forest of Van Cortlandt Park. Volunteers will assist our staff with the removal of shrub and vine species that harm the biodiversity and health of the park.

Bring along a water bottle and wear sturdy closed-toed shoes and long pants.

Please be advised that as of December 27, 2021, a vaccine mandate has been ordered by the City of New York. In order to participate in Van Cortlandt Park Alliance volunteer events, all volunteers must be vaccinated.

Start time: 9:00 am

End time: 12:00 pm

Contact phone: (718) 601-1460

Location: Woodlawn Playground (in Van Cortlandt Park)
categories: Nature | Volunteer

title: Wake Up, Daisy! at the Swedish Cottage Marionette Theatre
description:
Date: March 25, 2022

For more information on the Swedish Cottage Marionette Theatre, our COVID-19 policy and to purchase tickets, visit our website.

Wake Up, Daisy! tells the story of Daisy, a lively little girl living in the heart of New York City in an apartment overlooking Central Park. At Daisy’s much-anticipated birthday party, she encounters three special guests, known as her “Squad-parents”, from Brooklyn, Queens, and the Bronx who grant her the gifts of courage, knowledge, and a second chance. When an unwelcome guest shows up and casts a curse on her, Daisy’s life is forever changed. But through the support of her friends and an adventure throughout the city, Daisy’s strong self-determination and vivid imagination may be all she needs to break the curse.

Start time: 11:00 am

End time: 11:45 am

Contact phone: (212) 879-0794

title: Wake Up, Daisy! at the Swedish Cottage Marionette Theatre
description:
Date: March 25, 2022

For more information on the Swedish Cottage Marionette Theatre, our COVID-19 policy and to purchase tickets, visit our website.

Wake Up, Daisy! tells the story of Daisy, a lively little girl living in the heart of New York City in an apartment overlooking Central Park. At Daisy’s much-anticipated birthday party, she encounters three special guests, known as her “Squad-parents”, from Brooklyn, Queens, and the Bronx who grant her the gifts of courage, knowledge, and a second chance. When an unwelcome guest shows up and casts a curse on her, Daisy’s life is forever changed. But through the support of her friends and an adventure throughout the city, Daisy’s strong self-determination and vivid imagination may be all she needs to break the curse.

Start time: 1:00 pm

End time: 1:45 am

Contact phone: (212) 879-0794

Meet the challenge of swimming 25 miles or more over the summer months and earn a 25-miler t-shirt or test yourself by entering a top 3 swimmer competition at your pool and win a first, second or third place distance trophy. title: Forest Fitness
description:
Date: March 26, 2022

Join the Fort Tryon Park Trust for a free, year-round “Fitness at the Fort” exercise program on Tuesdays, Thursdays, and Saturdays! This regular fitness class incorporates climbing multiple staircases, stretches and strengthening exercises, notable tree identification, and forest bathing. Led by Nancy Bruning, BA, MPH, PAPHS.

Tuesdays at 7:30 a.m.: Easy Pace
Meet at the Heather Garden entrance. Walk along Stan Michels Promenade to Linden Terrace for dynamic warm-up stretching and cardio stair climbing. Walk south to Cabrini Woods for cardio steps and strengthening exercises and walk uphill to Billings Overlook for closing stretches.

Thursdays at 7:30 a.m.: Moderate Pace
Meet at the Heather Garden entrance and walk along Stan Michels Promenade to Linden Terrace for dynamic warm-up stretching and cardio stair climbing. Walk along the western path to Broadway, incorporating strengthening exercises, and walk uphill past Gazebo/Dog Run to Café Lawn, end with stretches.

Saturdays at 8:30 a.m.: Intense Pace
Meet at the Heather Garden entrance and walk along Stan Michels Promenade to Linden Terrace for dynamic warm-up stretch and cardio stair climbing. Walk along the western path to Broadway, incorporating strengthening exercises. Walk uphill towards Gazebo/Dog Run, utilizing a cluster of steps west of Broadway Path. Walk along the upper Alpine Garden path, to volleyball courts for stretches with final stair climbing to Margaret Corbin Circle.

(Note: Fitness Walking does not meet if it is raining or if the actual temperature or wind chill is below 20 degrees F.)

Start time: 8:30 am

End time: 9:30 am

Contact phone: 2127951388

Location: Margaret Corbin Circle (in Fort Tryon Park)
location: Margaret Corbin Circle (in Fort Tryon Park)
categories: Nature | Fitness | Seniors | Hiking | Exercise Classes | Strength Training/Weightlifting | Walking

title: GreenThumb Spring Supply Distribution
description:
Date: March 26, 2022

GreenThumb's Spring Supply Distribution for GreenThumb garden groups will be held at six gardens (listed below) on Saturday, March 26 from 10:00 a.m. to 1:00 p.m.

Garden groups should take inventory of the garden to identify materials and tools on hand. The Spring Supply Distribution offers a great opportunity to discuss with all garden members and identify shared priorities and needs for the upcoming gardening season. Groups should only take what is absolutely necessary, taking into account needs for the entire season.

GreenThumb garden groups, please RSVP for the location you will be picking up from at this link.

Available supplies include:

  • Neem Oil
  • Aprons
  • Goatskin Gloves
  • Loop Hoes
  • Watering Cans
  • Garden Gloves
  • Trowels
  • Pruners
  • Flexible bucket

Spring Supply Distribution Locations

BROOKLYN:

  • Hattie Carthan Community Garden
    719 Marcy Ave
    Brooklyn, NY 11216
  • Powell Street Garden
    410 Livonia Ave.
    Brooklyn, NY 11212

BRONX:

  • Friends of Brook Park
    494 East 141st Street
    Bronx, NY 10454

MANHATTAN:

  • Green Oasis Community Garden
    372 East 8th St
    New York, NY 10009

HARLEM:

  • New 123rd Street Block Association Community Garden
    116 W 123rd St
    New York, NY 10027

QUEENS:

  • Paradise Community Garden
    107-29 Inwood St
    Queens, NY 11435

*Only licensed GreenThumb garden groups in good standing are eligible. Gardens in schools, NYCHA developments, or privately-owned yards are not eligible.
*Esta distribución es solo para los jardines registrados con GreenThumb. Jardines escolares o en propiedad de NYCHA o patios privados sin acceso al público no son elegibles.

Please note: GreenThumb's Plant Starts Distribution will take place on Saturday May 7, 2022. We will ask GreenThumb gardeners to register for this event at a later date.

Start time: 10:00 am

End time: 1:00 pm

Contact phone:

Location: Hattie Carthan Community Garden,Green Oasis Community Garden/Gilbert's Garden,New 123rd Street Block Association Garden,Friends of Brook Park,Powell Street Garden,Paradise Community Garden

title: Wake Up, Daisy! at the Swedish Cottage Marionette Theatre
description:
Date: March 26, 2022

For more information on the Swedish Cottage Marionette Theatre, our COVID-19 policy and to purchase tickets, visit our website.

Wake Up, Daisy! tells the story of Daisy, a lively little girl living in the heart of New York City in an apartment overlooking Central Park. At Daisy’s much-anticipated birthday party, she encounters three special guests, known as her “Squad-parents”, from Brooklyn, Queens, and the Bronx who grant her the gifts of courage, knowledge, and a second chance. When an unwelcome guest shows up and casts a curse on her, Daisy’s life is forever changed. But through the support of her friends and an adventure throughout the city, Daisy’s strong self-determination and vivid imagination may be all she needs to break the curse.

Start time: 11:00 am

End time: 11:45 am

Contact phone: (212) 879-0794

Wake Up, Daisy! tells the story of Daisy, a lively little girl living in the heart of New York City in an apartment overlooking Central Park. At Daisy’s much-anticipated birthday party, she encounters three special guests, known as her “Squad-parents”, from Brooklyn, Queens, and the Bronx who grant her the gifts of courage, knowledge, and a second chance. When an unwelcome guest shows up and casts a curse on her, Daisy’s life is forever changed. But through the support of her friends and an adventure throughout the city, Daisy’s strong self-determination and vivid imagination may be all she needs to break the curse.

Wake Up, Daisy! tells the story of Daisy, a lively little girl living in the heart of New York City in an apartment overlooking Central Park. At Daisy’s much-anticipated birthday party, she encounters three special guests, known as her “Squad-parents”, from Brooklyn, Queens, and the Bronx who grant her the gifts of courage, knowledge, and a second chance. When an unwelcome guest shows up and casts a curse on her, Daisy’s life is forever changed. But through the support of her friends and an adventure throughout the city, Daisy’s strong self-determination and vivid imagination may be all she needs to break the curse.

Join the fun! The group will meet at the park sign at 190th Street and Fort Washington Avenue. title: Compost Site Tour: NYC Compost Project with Urban Park Rangers
description:
Date: March 27, 2022

See where we turn all that food waste into precious compost! Join the NYC Compost Project Hosted by Snug Harbor and NYC Urban Park Rangers for a tour of our compost site. Find out about how compost is made across the City, see different compost systems, and learn how we can turn organic waste into an environmental resource.

This event is held in partnership with NYC Parks.

The NYC Compost Project, created by the NYC Department of Sanitation (DSNY) in 1993, works to reduce waste in NYC and rebuild NYC’s soil by providing New Yorkers with the knowledge, skills, and opportunities they need to produce and use compost locally. NYC Compost Project programs and staff are funded and managed through the DSNY Bureau of Recycling and Sustainability (BRS) in partnership with host institutions.

All participants must be masked and socially distanced. This event is rain or shine.

Start time: 1:30 pm

End time: 2:30 pm

title: Forest Fitness
description:
Date: March 29, 2022

Join the Fort Tryon Park Trust for a free, year-round “Fitness at the Fort” exercise program on Tuesdays, Thursdays, and Saturdays! This regular fitness class incorporates climbing multiple staircases, stretches and strengthening exercises, notable tree identification, and forest bathing. Led by Nancy Bruning, BA, MPH, PAPHS.

Tuesdays at 7:30 a.m.: Easy Pace
Meet at the Heather Garden entrance. Walk along Stan Michels Promenade to Linden Terrace for dynamic warm-up stretching and cardio stair climbing. Walk south to Cabrini Woods for cardio steps and strengthening exercises and walk uphill to Billings Overlook for closing stretches.

Thursdays at 7:30 a.m.: Moderate Pace
Meet at the Heather Garden entrance and walk along Stan Michels Promenade to Linden Terrace for dynamic warm-up stretching and cardio stair climbing. Walk along the western path to Broadway, incorporating strengthening exercises, and walk uphill past Gazebo/Dog Run to Café Lawn, end with stretches.

Saturdays at 8:30 a.m.: Intense Pace
Meet at the Heather Garden entrance and walk along Stan Michels Promenade to Linden Terrace for dynamic warm-up stretch and cardio stair climbing. Walk along the western path to Broadway, incorporating strengthening exercises. Walk uphill towards Gazebo/Dog Run, utilizing a cluster of steps west of Broadway Path. Walk along the upper Alpine Garden path, to volleyball courts for stretches with final stair climbing to Margaret Corbin Circle.

(Note: Fitness Walking does not meet if it is raining or if the actual temperature or wind chill is below 20 degrees F.)

Start time: 7:30 am

End time: 8:30 am

Contact phone: (212) 795-1388

title: Virtual Special Express Writers
description:
Date: March 30, 2022

Illuminating the voices of adults living with developmental challenges.

Participants are guided through writing for self-expression via virtual class. Participants encourage and support each other. Patrons may dictate or write their stories. The facilitator focuses on the participants' strengths to assure their success. Participants submit stories to compile for a production.

Sessions are fluid to allow for individual differences and participants select who or what they wish to write to.

Participants should have an interest in writing stories and memoirs.

To register, please call (718) 365-5516 or email Lucy.Aponte@parksnyc.gov.

Start time: 10:00 am

End time: 12:30 pm

Meet the challenge of swimming 25 miles or more over the summer months and earn a 25-miler t-shirt or test yourself by entering a top 3 swimmer competition at your pool and win a first, second or third place distance trophy. title: Forest Fitness
description:
Date: March 31, 2022

Join the Fort Tryon Park Trust for a free, year-round “Fitness at the Fort” exercise program on Tuesdays, Thursdays, and Saturdays! This regular fitness class incorporates climbing multiple staircases, stretches and strengthening exercises, notable tree identification, and forest bathing. Led by Nancy Bruning, BA, MPH, PAPHS.

Tuesdays at 7:30 a.m.: Easy Pace
Meet at the Heather Garden entrance. Walk along Stan Michels Promenade to Linden Terrace for dynamic warm-up stretching and cardio stair climbing. Walk south to Cabrini Woods for cardio steps and strengthening exercises and walk uphill to Billings Overlook for closing stretches.

Thursdays at 7:30 a.m.: Moderate Pace
Meet at the Heather Garden entrance and walk along Stan Michels Promenade to Linden Terrace for dynamic warm-up stretching and cardio stair climbing. Walk along the western path to Broadway, incorporating strengthening exercises, and walk uphill past Gazebo/Dog Run to Café Lawn, end with stretches.

Saturdays at 8:30 a.m.: Intense Pace
Meet at the Heather Garden entrance and walk along Stan Michels Promenade to Linden Terrace for dynamic warm-up stretch and cardio stair climbing. Walk along the western path to Broadway, incorporating strengthening exercises. Walk uphill towards Gazebo/Dog Run, utilizing a cluster of steps west of Broadway Path. Walk along the upper Alpine Garden path, to volleyball courts for stretches with final stair climbing to Margaret Corbin Circle.

(Note: Fitness Walking does not meet if it is raining or if the actual temperature or wind chill is below 20 degrees F.)

Start time: 7:30 am

End time: 8:30 am

Contact phone: 2127951388

Location: Margaret Corbin Circle (in Fort Tryon Park)
location: Margaret Corbin Circle (in Fort Tryon Park)
categories: Nature | Fitness | Seniors | Hiking | Exercise Classes | Strength Training/Weightlifting | Walking
